title: Python coils itself around builder's neck and leaves him choking for breath
text:
A builder had to be rescued after a wild python wrapped itself around his neck in southern India.

Bhuvachandran Nair, 58, was hired to clear the bushes around a village in Kerala, on October 15.

He spotted a 10ft long wild snake and had his fellow workers help capture it.

Bhuvachandran Nair (pictured in white short-sleeved shirt) was clearing out bushes in a village in Kerala, southern India, on October 15, when he discovered a python. He asked his fellow workers to help rescue it before the snake slithered up his body and coiled around his neck (pictured)

But when he tried to force the python into a sack, it quickly reared up and slithered on to Bhuvanachandran’s body instead- before tightly coiling itself around his neck.

In the nerve-wracking clip, he can be seen trying to balance himself while two locals try to grab the opposite end of the snake and unwrap it from Bhuvanachandran’s neck.

The men hastily try to untie the snake with a piece of cloth to get a better grip on the reptile, just as the builder is choking for breath.

One of the fellow workers, who is from the Kerala Institute of Management, was determined to free his friend, on Tuesday

The builder waits patiently and does not speak a word during the tense clip where men force him to follow their lead so they can get rid of the snake

A joint effort: Two of the men work together to life the snake while others watch on baffled and shocked

They hold both end's of the python and lift it over the man's head and then pull the snake away and lower it to the ground.

Others stand back and spectate the incident, showing a mixture of shock and bafflement.

Moments later, three men steady their grip on the mottled snake and another runs over with a sack and lower the python inside.

Two men lowered the snake to the ground before a third member grabbed a sack to shove the reptile in. It was later released back into the wild by officials

Onlookers are mesmerised by the moment which saw Bhuvanachandran taken to hospital and treated for neck pain

The beastly animal was then handed to officials who released it back into the wild.

Bhuvanachandran was taken to hospital and treated for pain in neck and then later discharged.

The worker had been hired by the Kerala Institute of Management in the village of Neyyar near Kerala's capital, Thiruvananthapuram.
description: Bhuvachandran Nair was treated for neck pain at hospital after a python jumped up his body and coiled around his neck in village in Kerala, southern India, on October 15. Officials put it into the wild.
